instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMC’s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA: What is PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA? PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state that powers the SMC that comes from PP3V3_S5. A blown or corroded L4901 inductor behind it can kepe it from working, inductor number will differ depending on your board. .
definitions.SMC_TCK: What is SMC_TCK? SMC_TCK is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TDI: What is SMC_TDI? SMC_TDI is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TMS: What is SMC_TMS? SMC_TMS is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TDO: What is SMC_TDO? SMC_TDO is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light
threads.message:
I get a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with bad battery and some corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C7517</CAPACITOR> changed the cap and clean up the area but still no green light on charger 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is pretty low with 12,3V <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is present <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> is present too i reballed SMC but still no change some hints for me ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light
threads.message:
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> present?

Post voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light
threads.message:
Sry for late response was late here so here are the messurements
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3HAT</SIGNAL> <CAPACITOR>C6908</CAPACITOR> = 3,416V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R7940</RESISTOR> = 0V

I hope this are the right SCL/SDA lines:

<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL</SIGNAL> = 3,416V // .508
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA</SIGNAL> = 3,415 // .509

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light
threads.message:
Check voltage and signals for <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> (2 OF 2) at page 39.
Also check for 12MHz oscillation at Y5010.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R5010</RESISTOR>, <CAPACITOR>C5010</CAPACITOR>/11 and traces; may need to replace them, as Y5010 too.
DC voltage should be 1-1.2V approx; best to check with o-scope.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5010</RESISTOR> Value is OK
<CAPACITOR>C5010</CAPACITOR>/11 no short to ground caps are looking good
I don't have a dono (does is right ? Is it called dono ?) board ATM for this is 
if tried to test another crystal from a broken <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with 24Mhz I inject 1V and was taking a measurement with o-scope it was showing 24Mhz, so maybe It's possible to test this crystal the same way but don't know if SMC can handle this maybe de-solder it and try without the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Green Light
threads.message:
12MHz crystal is available on other MacBook boards.
You can't check the caps with your eyes.
If resistor is good, then try another crystal.
If still no signal, then change the caps.
